You’ll never agree because you can only see it from your perspective. Try playing a non mage while the AD player plays a mage and you’ll change your tone.

I don’t see 6 AD items giving 60+ AD and 300+ health. Mage items give an absurd amount of stats to compensate for being entirely spell oriented, but most AD champions are also spell oriented these days. 

AD champs have one item to counter mages - and it does it extremely well - but mages have like 6 to deal with AD champions or universal damage in general. Opinions differ depending on player skill, because the mages need to be smart enough to actually build the right items and know how to use them to succeed, but when they do they’re so hopelessly oppressive they shape the entire meta - look at Swain before his huge rebalance.

Ad items dont give 60 ad and 300 hp because of how physical damage works, aka auto attacks.  

Ad champs have one item to counter mages? What? Ad have these {{item:3231}} {{item:3163}} {{item:3814}} (hp helps against burst dmg aka almost all mages) {{item:3812}} (delays burst) {{item:3111}} {{item:3046}} ( niche item but against burst it helps a lot)

Mages have 6 items to deal with ad champs or dmg in general? What? Almost all of their items give hp which as said earlier helps against burst. However ad champs deal sustained damage, in addition to any burst like dmg. Hp is way WAY less effective against sustained damage. You dont reduce the dmg you get. You just increase the time it takes for you to die. However with just the sheer number of dmg you take (sustained damage) hp alone doesnt help (in order to reduce dmg effectively you need both hp and resistances). Then there is all the %hp dmg which becomes more effective the more hp you have.

QSS is usless against burst anything. I could probably kill through a maw of malmortius on most of the mages in the game. Hell, I've done it before on Ekko versus Zed, the supposed bane of all mages, and apparently the most overpowered champ in the game, while he had a hexdrinker. And edge of night has to be charged and can be destroyed by a Luden's proc. Death's dance only helps in All-ins, otherwise you're still dead anyway, Merc treads are hardly a counter to AP even in comparison to the other items, and Phantom Dancer is an anomaly, an abomination of an item that should be deleted from the game anyway. And most AP champs have somewhat sustained damage as well, with their 3-5 second CDs on half their abilities.
AP itemization has:
Zero thought spell shield
Armor
MR
Zhonya's
Big shield
HP
Speed
Slows
More slows
Super Burning Power

Meanwhile, AD has items split among classes, meaning that over 1/2 of AD itemization is completely useless to any given AD champion. AP itemization is definitely superior.
Ekko is an Assassin not a Mage.
except ekko has even shittier base damages than most mages.

You’ve never faced a Swain/Ahri/Karthus/Ekko/Fizz with 3.5k hp and 600 AP on top of hourglass. They’re solocarry material to say the least. Never mind sustained damage, they can take down most marksmen at the same time as their mid lane assassins late game. They’re a huge issue in the middle elos on EUW because to effectively tank and chip them down your front liners need to build pure magic resist, which leaves thrm defenseless agains mixed damage comps. 

Current AP items can turn nearly all mages into Juggernauts. As long as they have at least one defensive tool in their kit, you need 3-4 people to focus them down to kill them. They’re tankier than most bruisers (health akin to pure tanks, but lacking the resistances - with the exception of aftershock Diana) and serve as better offtanks than AD bruisers DESIGNED to be, such as Nasus.

Unfortunately we’re still stuck in the outdated mindset that mages are inherently weaker than all other classes, so Riot is terrified of community backlash if they were to accept they’re equal if not stronger than AD champs.

Yes, if you try to trade with a level 2 Talon you’re going to lose your lane. He’s the Pantheon of mid lane. You dont see top laners condemning assassins / divers and their items universally because of Pantheon. They just learn to give up early lane to have their retribution later. Likewise, that a mage struggles against a deliberate antimage does not mean mages and their items are bad.

Also, lets be real - when was the last time you saw somebody build mercurial scimitar, edge of night or phantom dancer? Never mind assassins, in the game in general?

You’re lucky if the game lasts long enough for anybody to pick up Death’s dance, and even then there are like three champions that can properly utilize it - as a snowballing luxury item.

Here's the thing:

The sheer amount of pen offered to ap champs is fucking mind blowing. It doesn't take much gold to start landing true damage on people if they don't invest in MR to keep up.

I like to keep it neutral, but 33 flat pen + 40% pen is fucking strong. You can pen a SHIT ton of, if not all of, someone's MR off of about 7k gold.

Don't AD champs have more Penetration (UPDATE: Options)?

{{item:3036}} {{item:3033}} {{item:3071}}  {{item:3142}} {{item:3147}} {{item:3814}}

Two of those don’t stack (LDR and Mortal)

One is a bruiser item that Lucian happens to use.

Nobody actually touches Edge of Night.

Lastly, Lethality scales with levels, meaning you don’t even get full value til late game.

Even with full Lethality, you’re not dropping anyone’s effective armor to nil.

Meanwhile Mages Sorc Boots and Oblivion Orb are pretty much core unless you have retarded AP ratios like Veigar. And you get full value upon purchase, meaning you can potentially deal true damage.

A stronger argument would be “mages have spells that can miss and have cooldowns compared to autos + abilities, so having stronger pen is warranted” rather than going for “DAE LETHALITY LMAO”

From an outside perspective (I pretty much only play tanks)  AD have a far better time stacking penetration.  Their items are cheaper, have better build components, and at full build have more penetration.

{{item:3134}} is an 1100g, builds into {{item:3147}} {{item:3142}} (people dont build {{item:3814}} ) which gives 39 lethality.  Those champs can also build {{item:3071}} for 24% armor shred, but more importantly 20% CDR, {{item:3035}} for 1300g, and finish into {{item:3036}} for 35% armor pen.  At double lethality, they deal close to true damage to anyone with 0 armor items, add BC and they deal near true to people with 1-2 armor items, and at all 4 they deal true damage to everyone who doesnt have 3+ armor items, and they still deal great damage against that person.

Compound this with most AD champs who go lethality dont have mana, so they dont have to postpone damage for some sort of sustainment item.  And they double dip on this because they deal this extra damage on autos as well as skills, while 90% of AP champs dont.  Also the only armor items that people can build when going damage are {{item:3026}} {{item:3157}} , the first of which is a horrible rush, and the second postpones your damage and lane mana sustainment that 90% of mages need.

Compare this with AP pen and how to build against it.  AP get 3 total pen items {{item:3020}} {{item:3165}} {{item:3135}} Sorcs + obliv orb (morellos component for 1500g)  gives 30 MR pen.  but rushing double pen items means that you have no defenses and no mana sustainment. So it only works on rumble.  Void staff costs 2650g, only 150 less than a completed upgrade of the LW line, but it has no early component.  

And unlike trying to counter build AD items, AD/MR items that people can build are far more prevalent. {{item:3155}} is one of the most efficient items in the game.  {{item:3140}} {{item:3139}} {{item:3111}} {{item:3102}} are all options that people regularly go for.

Yes, it provides unit returns to scale in the absence of any pen, true damage, or % hp damage.  You will virtually never not be hit by some combination of true damage, % hp damage, and reductions/pen though.

Last time AP was overall stronger than AD was when Zhonya and rabadon were 1 item.

And after AD item rework the AD > AP gap got wider.

Then with ~~mage ~~ support class rework AP gone to shithole and hardly bothered to crawl out of.

In a vacuum, ap items give just as much if not more secondary effects than ad items. The reason why ad champions are stronger is because ap ratios have been going down over time while ad ratios have become more prominent. 

There is definitely an underlying design mismatch. However, I can easily see an argument for turning back champion design back to what it was in earlier seasons which would mean more spells get ap ratios and less spells getting ad ratios.

False, factually it's exactly the other way around: The ratios are still the same, 0.6-0.75 being the standart AP scaling, the AP on items has been decreased alot - standat AP for an AP item used to be 120 with DFG, Zhonya and old Rabadon's (which only got it's % AP multiplier increased and thus made it a must-have item for heavy AP scalers in order to be viable). Today standart AP item has 75 AP, that's like 6/10 of the original value.

Edit: Unless you mean ration on items which is bad wording because noone refers to it like this.

Also, where do you see those "more" secondary effects? In vacuum the AP items have definetely the same amount of passives/actives while being arguably weaker (Zhonya vs. GA, Banshee's vs. MoM - hell, Banshee's passive is hella weaker than Hexdrinker alone!).

It's always been like this. People for some reason believe AP is superior and every time you tell them how wrong they are they bring up one thing: {{item:3157}} One thing that has been nerfed into the ground so hard it's only bought because you absolutely need it to survive anything.

Long ago the two damage itemizations lived in harmony. AP was expensive but compensated by utility and upfront damage. AD was cheaper but inefficient. Then everything changed when the balance team thought they could bring balance.
